intro: Neotessmannia uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower neotessmannia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a smooth, glossy surface. Neotessmannia uniflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
